boomburst: The user attacks everything around it with the destructive power of a terrible, explosive sound.
aeroblast: A vortex of air is shot at the target to inflict damage. Critical hits land more easily.
acupressure: The user applies pressure to stress points, sharply boosting one of its or its allies’ stats.
acid: The opposing Pokémon are attacked with a spray of harsh acid. This may also lower their Sp. Def stats.
acid armor: The user alters its cellular structure to liquefy itself, sharply raising its Defense stat.
acid spray: The user spits fluid that works to melt the target. This harshly lowers the target’s Sp. Def stat.
dark void: Opposing Pokémon are dragged into a world of total darkness that makes them sleep.
parabolic charge: The user attacks everything around it. The user’s HP is restored by half the damage taken by those hit.
mystical fire: The user attacks by breathing a special, hot fire. This also lowers the target’s Sp. Atk stat.
absorb: A nutrient-draining attack. The user’s HP is restored by half the damage taken by the target.
night daze: The user lets loose a pitch-black shock wave at its target. This may also lower the target’s accuracy.
oblivion wing: The user absorbs its target’s HP. The user’s HP is restored by over half of the damage taken by the target.
amnesia: The user temporarily empties its mind to forget its concerns. This sharply raises the user’s Sp. Def stat.
dazzling gleam: The user damages opposing Pokémon by emitting a powerful flash.
after you: The user helps the target and makes it use its move right after the user.
bone club: The user clubs the target with a bone. This may also make the target flinch.
bolt strike: The user surrounds itself with a great amount of electricity and charges its target. This may also leave the target with paralysis.
shell smash: The user breaks its shell, which lowers Defense and Sp. Def stats but sharply raises its Attack, Sp. Atk, and Speed stats.
withdraw: The user withdraws its body into its hard shell, raising its Defense stat.
ally switch: The user teleports using a strange power and switches places with one of its allies.
trick-or-treat: The user takes the target trick-or-treating. This adds Ghost type to the target’s type.
nuzzle: The user attacks by nuzzling its electrified cheeks against the target. This also leaves the target with paralysis.
power trick: The user employs its psychic power to switch its Attack with its Defense stat.
sketch: It enables the user to permanently learn the move last used by the target. Once used, Sketch disappears.
dark pulse: The user releases a horrible aura imbued with dark thoughts. This may also make the target flinch.
wake-up slap: This attack inflicts big damage on a sleeping target. This also wakes the target up, however.
twineedle: The user damages the target twice in succession by jabbing it with two spikes. This may also poison the target.
sky uppercut: The user attacks the target with an uppercut thrown skyward with force.
bestow: The user passes its held item to the target when the target isn’t holding an item.
night slash: The user slashes the target the instant an opportunity arises. Critical hits land more easily.
petal dance: The user attacks the target by scattering petals for two to three turns. The user then becomes confused.
cotton guard: The user protects itself by wrapping its body in soft cotton, which drastically raises the user’s Defense stat.
dragon rush: The user tackles the target while exhibiting overwhelming menace. This may also make the target flinch.
nightmare: A sleeping target sees a nightmare that inflicts some damage every turn.
seed flare: The user emits a shock wave from its body to attack its target. This may also harshly lower the target’s Sp. Def.
psybeam: The target is attacked with a peculiar ray. This may also leave the target confused.
bounce: The user bounces up high, then drops on the target on the second turn. This may also leave the target with paralysis.
volt tackle: The user electrifies itself, then charges. This also damages the user quite a lot. This may leave the target with paralysis.
detect: Enables the user to evade all attacks. Its chance of failing rises if it is used in succession.
vacuum wave: The user whirls its fists to send a wave of pure vacuum at the target. This move always goes first.
skull bash: The user tucks in its head to raise its Defense in the first turn, then rams the target on the next turn.
avalanche: An attack move that inflicts double the damage if the user has been hurt by the target in the same turn.
psystrike: The user materializes an odd psychic wave to attack the target. This attack does physical damage.
crush grip: The target is crushed with great force. The more HP the target has left, the greater this move’s power.
spark: The user throws an electrically charged tackle at the target. This may also leave the target with paralysis.
cross chop: The user delivers a double chop with its forearms crossed. Critical hits land more easily.
teleport: Use it to flee from any wild Pokémon. It can also warp to the last Pokémon Center visited.
petal blizzard: The user stirs up a violent petal blizzard and attacks everything around it.
spacial rend: The user tears the target along with the space around it. Critical hits land more easily.
psycho cut: The user tears at the target with blades formed by psychic power. Critical hits land more easily.
punishment: The more the target has powered up with stat changes, the greater the move’s power.
sing: A soothing lullaby is sung in a calming voice that puts the target into a deep slumber.
sacred sword: The user attacks by slicing with a long horn. The target’s stat changes don’t affect this attack’s damage.
destiny bond: When this move is used, if the user faints, the Pokémon that landed the knockout hit also faints.
acrobatics: The user nimbly strikes the target. If the user is not holding an item, this attack inflicts massive damage.
night shade: The user makes the target see a frightening mirage. It inflicts damage equal to the user’s level.
drain punch: An energy-draining punch. The user’s HP is restored by half the damage taken by the target.
v-create: With a hot flame on its forehead, the user hurls itself at its target. This lowers the user’s Defense, Sp. Def, and Speed stats.
x-scissor: The user slashes at the target by crossing its scythes or claws as if they were a pair of scissors.
thrash: The user rampages and attacks for two to three turns. The user then becomes confused.
venom drench: Opposing Pokémon are drenched in an odd poisonous liquid. This lowers the Attack, Sp. Atk, and Speed stats of a poisoned target.
shadow force: The user disappears, then strikes the target on the next turn. This move hits even if the target protects itself.
air cutter: The user launches razor-like wind to slash the opposing Pokémon. Critical hits land more easily.
belly drum: The user maximizes its Attack stat in exchange for HP equal to half its max HP.
venoshock: The user drenches the target in a special poisonous liquid. This move’s power is doubled if the target is poisoned.
shift gear: The user rotates its gears, raising its Attack and sharply raising its Speed.
pound: The target is physically pounded with a long tail, a foreleg, or the like.
wing attack: The target is struck with large, imposing wings spread wide to inflict damage.
bubble: A spray of countless bubbles is jetted at the opposing Pokémon. This may also lower their Speed stats.
pin missile: Sharp spikes are shot at the target in rapid succession. They hit two to five times in a row.
skill swap: The user employs its psychic power to exchange Abilities with the target.
poison fang: The user bites the target with toxic fangs. This may also leave the target badly poisoned.
power whip: The user violently whirls its vines or tentacles to harshly lash the target.
soft-boiled: The user restores its own HP by up to half of its max HP. May also be used in the field to heal HP.
vice grip: The target is gripped and squeezed from both sides to inflict damage.
trump card: The fewer PP this move has, the greater its power.
supersonic: The user generates odd sound waves from its body that confuse the target.
stockpile: The user charges up power and raises both its Defense and Sp. Def stats. The move can be used three times.
psycho boost: The user attacks the target at full power. The attack’s recoil harshly lowers the user’s Sp. Atk stat.
aura sphere: The user lets loose a blast of aura power from deep within its body at the target. This attack never misses.
brave bird: The user tucks in its wings and charges from a low altitude. This also damages the user quite a lot.
electrify: If the target is electrified before it uses a move during that turn, the target’s move becomes Electric type.
quick guard: The user protects itself and its allies from priority moves.
play rough: The user plays rough with the target and attacks it. This may also lower the target’s Attack stat.
bite: The target is bitten with viciously sharp fangs. This may also make the target flinch.
sharpen: The user lowers its polygon count to make itself more jagged, raising the Attack stat.
sky drop: The user takes the target into the sky, then drops it during the next turn. The target cannot attack while in the sky.
bug buzz: The user vibrates its wings to generate a damaging sound wave. This may also lower the target’s Sp. Def stat.
disarming voice: Letting out a charming cry, the user does emotional damage to opposing Pokémon. This attack never misses.
power swap: The user employs its psychic power to switch changes to its Attack and Sp. Atk stats with the target.
wring out: The user powerfully wrings the target. The more HP the target has, the greater the move’s power.
wood hammer: The user slams its rugged body into the target to attack. This also damages the user quite a lot.
slack off: The user slacks off, restoring its own HP by up to half of its max HP.
simple beam: The user’s mysterious psychic wave changes the target’s Ability to Simple.
vine whip: The target is struck with slender, whiplike vines to inflict damage.
defend order: The user calls out its underlings to shield its body, raising its Defense and Sp. Def stats.
topsy-turvy: All stat changes affecting the target turn topsy-turvy and become the opposite of what they were.
stored power: The user attacks the target with stored power. The more the user’s stats are raised, the greater the move’s power.
transform: The user transforms into a copy of the target right down to having the same move set.
aromatherapy: The user releases a soothing scent that heals all status conditions affecting the user’s party.
crabhammer: The target is hammered with a large pincer. Critical hits land more easily.
draco meteor: Comets are summoned down from the sky onto the target. The attack’s recoil harshly lowers the user’s Sp. Atk stat.
will-o-wisp: The user shoots a sinister, bluish-white flame at the target to inflict a burn.
comet punch: The target is hit with a flurry of punches that strike two to five times in a row.
clear smog: The user attacks by throwing a clump of special mud. All stat changes are returned to normal.
tickle: The user tickles the target into laughing, reducing its Attack and Defense stats.
feint: An attack that hits a target using Protect or Detect. This also lifts the effects of those moves.
charge: The user boosts the power of the Electric move it uses on the next turn. This also raises the user’s Sp. Def stat.
triple kick: A consecutive three-kick attack that becomes more powerful with each successive hit.
reversal: An all-out attack that becomes more powerful the less HP the user has.
astonish: The user attacks the target while shouting in a startling fashion. This may also make the target flinch.
curse: A move that works differently for the Ghost type than for all other types.
dragon tail: The target is knocked away, and a different Pokémon is dragged out. In the wild, this ends a battle against a single Pokémon.
poison sting: The user stabs the target with a poisonous stinger. This may also poison the target.
grass whistle: The user plays a pleasant melody that lulls the target into a deep sleep.
force palm: The target is attacked with a shock wave. This may also leave the target with paralysis.
powder snow: The user attacks with a chilling gust of powdery snow. This may also freeze the opposing Pokémon.
splash: The user just flops and splashes around to no effect at all...
bulk up: The user tenses its muscles to bulk up its body, raising both its Attack and Defense stats.
baton pass: The user switches places with a party Pokémon in waiting and passes along any stat changes.
volt switch: After making its attack, the user rushes back to switch places with a party Pokémon in waiting.
circle throw: The target is thrown, and a different Pokémon is dragged out. In the wild, this ends a battle against a single Pokémon.
grassy terrain: The user turns the ground under everyone’s feet to grass for five turns. This restores the HP of Pokémon on the ground a little every turn.
double hit: The user slams the target with a long tail, vines, or a tentacle. The target is hit twice in a row.
rock blast: The user hurls hard rocks at the target. Two to five rocks are launched in a row.
soak: The user shoots a torrent of water at the target and changes the target’s type to Water.
me first: The user cuts ahead of the target to steal and use the target’s intended move with greater power. This move fails if it isn’t used first.
struggle bug: While resisting, the user attacks the opposing Pokémon. This lowers the Sp. Atk stat of those hit.
metal sound: A horrible sound like scraping metal harshly lowers the target’s Sp. Def stat.
grass pledge: A column of grass hits the target. When used with its water equivalent, its damage increases and a vast swamp appears.
lock-on: The user takes sure aim at the target. This ensures the next attack does not miss the target.
slam: The target is slammed with a long tail, vines, or the like to inflict damage.
super fang: The user chomps hard on the target with its sharp front fangs. This cuts the target’s HP in half.
bug bite: The user bites the target. If the target is holding a Berry, the user eats it and gains its effect.
fire pledge: A column of fire hits the target. When used with its grass equivalent, its damage increases and a vast sea of fire appears.
cross poison: A slashing attack with a poisonous blade that may also poison the target. Critical hits land more easily.
u-turn: After making its attack, the user rushes back to switch places with a party Pokémon in waiting.
self-destruct: The user attacks everything around it by causing an explosion. The user faints upon using this move.
misty terrain: The user covers the ground under everyone’s feet with mist for five turns. This protects Pokémon on the ground from status conditions.
dual chop: The user attacks its target by hitting it with brutal strikes. The target is hit twice in a row.
milk drink: The user restores its own HP by up to half of its max HP. May also be used in the field to heal HP.
ancient power: The user attacks with a prehistoric power. This may also raise all the user’s stats at once.
sludge: Unsanitary sludge is hurled at the target. This may also poison the target.
waterfall: The user charges at the target and may make it flinch. This can also be used to climb a waterfall.
mega drain: A nutrient-draining attack. The user’s HP is restored by half the damage taken by the target.
blast burn: The target is razed by a fiery explosion. The user can’t move on the next turn.
drill peck: A corkscrewing attack with a sharp beak acting as a drill.
final gambit: The user risks everything to attack its target. The user faints but does damage equal to its HP.
aqua ring: The user envelops itself in a veil made of water. It regains some HP every turn.
poison gas: A cloud of poison gas is sprayed in the face of opposing Pokémon. This may also poison those hit.
pursuit: An attack move that inflicts double damage if used on a target that is switching out of battle.
mean look: The user pins the target with a dark, arresting look. The target becomes unable to flee.
vital throw: The user attacks last. In return, this throw move never misses.
sky attack: A second-turn attack move where critical hits land more easily. This may also make the target flinch.
mega kick: The target is attacked by a kick launched with muscle-packed power.
spikes: The user lays a trap of spikes at the opposing team’s feet. The trap hurts Pokémon that switch into battle.
sludge bomb: Unsanitary sludge is hurled at the target. This may also poison the target.
diamond storm: The user whips up a storm of diamonds to damage opposing Pokémon. This may also raise the user’s Defense stat.
pluck: The user pecks the target. If the target is holding a Berry, the user eats it and gains its effect.
eerie impulse: The user’s body generates an eerie impulse. Exposing the target to it harshly lowers the target’s Sp. Atk stat.
draining kiss: The user steals the target’s energy with a kiss. The user’s HP is restored by over half of the damage taken by the target.
lovely kiss: With a scary face, the user tries to force a kiss on the target. If it succeeds, the target falls asleep.
aurora beam: The target is hit with a rainbow-colored beam. This may also lower the target’s Attack stat.
morning sun: The user restores its own HP. The amount of HP regained varies with the weather.
mud shot: The user attacks by hurling a blob of mud at the target. This also lowers the target’s Speed stat.
gravity: Gravity is intensified for five turns, making moves involving flying unusable and negating Levitate.
fairy wind: The user stirs up a fairy wind and strikes the target with it.
mist: The user cloaks itself and its allies in a white mist that prevents any of their stats from being lowered for five turns.
luster purge: The user lets loose a damaging burst of light. This may also lower the target’s Sp. Def stat.
sweet scent: A sweet scent that harshly lowers opposing Pokémon’s evasiveness. This also lures wild Pokémon if used in places such as tall grass.
spike cannon: Sharp spikes are shot at the target in rapid succession. They hit two to five times in a row.
blaze kick: The user launches a kick that lands a critical hit more easily. This may also leave the target with a burn.
wish: One turn after this move is used, the target’s HP is restored by half the user’s max HP.
phantom force: The user vanishes somewhere, then strikes the target on the next turn. This move hits even if the target protects itself.
slash: The target is attacked with a slash of claws or blades. Critical hits land more easily.
bullet punch: The user strikes the target with tough punches as fast as bullets. This move always goes first.
frenzy plant: The user slams the target with an enormous tree. The user can’t move on the next turn.
electroweb: The user attacks and captures opposing Pokémon using an electric net. This lowers their Speed stat.
sonic boom: The target is hit with a destructive shock wave that always inflicts 20 HP damage.
toxic spikes: The user lays a trap of poison spikes at the opposing team’s feet. They poison opposing Pokémon that switch into battle.
glare: The user intimidates the target with the pattern on its belly to cause paralysis.
brine: If the target’s HP is half or less, this attack will hit with double the power.
play nice: The user and the target become friends, and the target loses its will to fight. This lowers the target’s Attack stat.
sludge wave: The user strikes everything around it by swamping the area with a giant sludge wave. This may also poison those hit.
constrict: The target is attacked with long, creeping tentacles or vines. This may also lower the target’s Speed stat.
aromatic mist: The user raises the Sp. Def stat of an ally Pokémon by using a mysterious aroma.
guillotine: A vicious, tearing attack with big pincers. The target faints instantly if this attack hits.
assurance: If the target has already taken some damage in the same turn, this attack’s power is doubled.
metal claw: The target is raked with steel claws. This may also raise the user’s Attack stat.
smelling salts: This attack inflicts double damage on a target with paralysis. This also cures the target’s paralysis, however.
water pledge: A column of water strikes the target. When combined with its fire equivalent, the damage increases and a rainbow appears.
flame wheel: The user cloaks itself in fire and charges at the target. This may also leave the target with a burn.
fake tears: The user feigns crying to fluster the target, harshly lowering its Sp. Def stat.
assist: The user hurriedly and randomly uses a move among those known by other Pokémon in the party.
moonblast: Borrowing the power of the moon, the user attacks the target. This may also lower the target’s Sp. Atk stat.
trick: The user catches the target off guard and swaps its held item with its own.
rollout: The user continually rolls into the target over five turns. It becomes more powerful each time it hits.
water spout: The user spouts water to damage opposing Pokémon. The lower the user’s HP, the lower the move’s power.
whirlwind: The target is blown away, and a different Pokémon is dragged out. In the wild, this ends a battle against a single Pokémon.
minimize: The user compresses its body to make itself look smaller, which sharply raises its evasiveness.
searing shot: The user torches everything around it with an inferno of scarlet flames. This may also leave those hit with a burn.
mist ball: A mist-like flurry of down envelops and damages the target. This may also lower the target’s Sp. Atk stat.
double kick: The target is quickly kicked twice in succession using both feet.
magic room: The user creates a bizarre area in which Pokémon’s held items lose their effects for five turns.
moonlight: The user restores its own HP. The amount of HP regained varies with the weather.
memento: The user faints when using this move. In return, this harshly lowers the target’s Attack and Sp. Atk stats.
hydro cannon: The target is hit with a watery blast. The user can’t move on the next turn.
mirror shot: The user lets loose a flash of energy at the target from its polished body. This may also lower the target’s accuracy.
forest's curse: The user puts a forest curse on the target. Afflicted targets are now Grass type as well.
water gun: The target is blasted with a forceful shot of water.
horn drill: The user stabs the target with a horn that rotates like a drill. The target faints instantly if this attack hits.
defense curl: The user curls up to conceal weak spots and raise its Defense stat.
storm throw: The user strikes the target with a fierce blow. This attack always results in a critical hit.
smokescreen: The user releases an obscuring cloud of smoke or ink. This lowers the target’s accuracy.
arm thrust: The user lets loose a flurry of open-palmed arm thrusts that hit two to five times in a row.
bide: The user endures attacks for two turns, then strikes back to cause double the damage taken.
fusion flare: The user brings down a giant flame. This move is more powerful when influenced by an enormous thunderbolt.
counter: A retaliation move that counters any physical attack, inflicting double the damage taken.
autotomize: The user sheds part of its body to make itself lighter and sharply raise its Speed stat.
quiver dance: The user lightly performs a beautiful, mystic dance. This boosts the user’s Sp. Atk, Sp. Def, and Speed stats.
psycho shift: Using its psychic power of suggestion, the user transfers its status conditions to the target.
heat crash: The user slams its target with its flame-covered body. The more the user outweighs the target, the greater the move’s power.
smog: The target is attacked with a discharge of filthy gases. This may also poison the target.
conversion 2: The user changes its type to make itself resistant to the type of the attack the opponent used last.
fissure: The user opens up a fissure in the ground and drops the target in. The target faints instantly if this attack hits.
icicle crash: The user attacks by harshly dropping large icicles onto the target. This may also make the target flinch.
torment: The user torments and enrages the target, making it incapable of using the same move twice in a row.
muddy water: The user attacks by shooting muddy water at the opposing Pokémon. This may also lower their accuracy.
drill run: The user crashes into its target while rotating its body like a drill. Critical hits land more easily.
mud sport: The user covers itself with mud. This weakens Electric-type moves for five turns.
heal block: For five turns, the user prevents the opposing team from using any moves, Abilities, or held items that recover HP.
needle arm: The user attacks by wildly swinging its thorny arms. This may also make the target flinch.
electric terrain: The user electrifies the ground under everyone’s feet for five turns. Pokémon on the ground no longer fall asleep.
baby-doll eyes: The user stares at the target with its baby-doll eyes, which lowers its Attack stat. This move always goes first.
teeter dance: The user performs a wobbly dance that confuses the Pokémon around it.
water shuriken: The user hits the target with throwing stars two to five times in a row. This move always goes first.
lick: The target is licked with a long tongue, causing damage. This may also leave the target with paralysis.
extreme speed: The user charges the target at blinding speed. This move always goes first.
power gem: The user attacks with a ray of light that sparkles as if it were made of gemstones.
weather ball: An attack move that varies in power and type depending on the weather.
hypnosis: The user employs hypnotic suggestion to make the target fall into a deep sleep.
magnitude: The user attacks everything around it with a ground-shaking quake. Its power varies.
false swipe: A restrained attack that prevents the target from fainting. The target is left with at least 1 HP.
hurricane: The user attacks by wrapping its opponent in a fierce wind that flies up into the sky. This may also confuse the target.
reflect type: The user reflects the target’s type, making it the same type as the target.
bullet seed: The user forcefully shoots seeds at the target two to five times in a row.
gear grind: The user attacks by throwing steel gears at its target twice.
swallow: The power stored using the move Stockpile is absorbed by the user to heal its HP. Storing more power heals more HP.
fire spin: The target becomes trapped within a fierce vortex of fire that rages for four to five turns.
synchronoise: Using an odd shock wave, the user inflicts damage on any Pokémon of the same type in the area around it.
barrage: Round objects are hurled at the target to strike two to five times in a row.
happy hour: Using Happy Hour doubles the amount of prize money received after battle.
pain split: The user adds its HP to the target’s HP, then equally shares the combined HP with the target.
mega punch: The target is slugged by a punch thrown with muscle-packed power.
metronome: The user waggles a finger and stimulates its brain into randomly using nearly any move.
fusion bolt: The user throws down a giant thunderbolt. This move is more powerful when influenced by an enormous flame.
fiery dance: Cloaked in flames, the user dances and flaps its wings. This may also raise the user’s Sp. Atk stat.
egg bomb: A large egg is hurled at the target with maximum force to inflict damage.
yawn: The user lets loose a huge yawn that lulls the target into falling asleep on the next turn.
steamroller: The user crushes its targets by rolling over them with its rolled-up body. This may also make the target flinch.
imprison: If opposing Pokémon know any move also known by the user, they are prevented from using it.
inferno: The user attacks by engulfing the target in an intense fire. This leaves the target with a burn.
relic song: The user sings an ancient song and attacks by appealing to the hearts of the listening opposing Pokémon. This may also induce sleep.
grudge: If the user faints, the user’s grudge fully depletes the PP of the opponent’s move that knocked it out.
heart swap: The user employs its psychic power to switch stat changes with the target.
zap cannon: The user fires an electric blast like a cannon to inflict damage and cause paralysis.
present: The user attacks by giving the target a gift with a hidden trap. It restores HP sometimes, however.
aqua tail: The user attacks by swinging its tail as if it were a vicious wave in a raging storm.
rage: As long as this move is in use, the power of rage raises the Attack stat each time the user is hit in battle.
crafty shield: The user protects itself and its allies from status moves with a mysterious power. This does not stop moves that do damage.
fury swipes: The target is raked with sharp claws or scythes quickly two to five times in a row.
future sight: Two turns after this move is used, a hunk of psychic energy attacks the target.
rock polish: The user polishes its body to reduce drag. This can sharply raise the Speed stat.
magma storm: The target becomes trapped within a maelstrom of fire that rages for four to five turns.
ingrain: The user lays roots that restore its HP on every turn. Because it is rooted, it can’t switch out.
air slash: The user attacks with a blade of air that slices even the sky. This may also make the target flinch.
techno blast: The user fires a beam of light at its target. The move’s type changes depending on the Drive the user holds.
quash: The user suppresses the target and makes its move go last.
bubble beam: A spray of bubbles is forcefully ejected at the target. This may also lower its Speed stat.
celebrate: The Pokémon congratulates you on your special day!
karate chop: The target is attacked with a sharp chop. Critical hits land more easily.
flare blitz: The user cloaks itself in fire and charges the target. This also damages the user quite a lot. This may leave the target with a burn.
leaf tornado: The user attacks its target by encircling it in sharp leaves. This attack may also lower the target’s accuracy.
gastro acid: The user hurls up its stomach acids on the target. The fluid eliminates the effect of the target’s Ability.
power-up punch: Striking opponents over and over makes the user’s fists harder. Hitting a target raises the Attack stat.
secret sword: The user cuts with its long horn. The odd power contained in the horn does physical damage to the target.
howl: The user howls loudly to raise its spirit, which raises its Attack stat.
smack down: The user throws a stone or similar projectile to attack an opponent. A flying Pokémon will fall to the ground when it’s hit.
fell stinger: When the user knocks out a target with this move, the user’s Attack stat rises sharply.
spit up: The power stored using the move Stockpile is released at once in an attack. The more power is stored, the greater the move’s power.
tail slap: The user attacks by striking the target with its hard tail. It hits the target two to five times in a row.
psywave: The target is attacked with an odd psychic wave. The attack varies in intensity.
stun spore: The user scatters a cloud of numbing powder that paralyzes the target.
lava plume: The user torches everything around it with an inferno of scarlet flames. This may also leave those hit with a burn.
flying press: The user dives down onto the target from the sky. This move is Fighting and Flying type simultaneously.
charm: The user gazes at the target rather charmingly, making it less wary. This harshly lowers its Attack stat.
hail: The user summons a hailstorm lasting five turns. It damages all Pokémon except the Ice type.
leech seed: A seed is planted on the target. It steals some HP from the target every turn.
rapid spin: A spin attack that can also eliminate such moves as Bind, Wrap, Leech Seed, and Spikes.
block: The user blocks the target’s way with arms spread wide to prevent escape.
mud bomb: The user launches a hard-packed mud ball to attack. This may also lower the target’s accuracy.
sticky web: The user weaves a sticky net around the opposing team, which lowers their Speed stat upon switching into battle.
sweet kiss: The user kisses the target with a sweet, angelic cuteness that causes confusion.
last resort: This move can be used only after the user has used all the other moves it knows in the battle.
echoed voice: The user attacks the target with an echoing voice. If this move is used every turn, it does greater damage.
doom desire: Two turns after this move is used, the user blasts the target with a concentrated bundle of light.
iron head: The user slams the target with its steel-hard head. This may also make the target flinch.
leer: The user gives opposing Pokémon an intimidating leer that lowers the Defense stat.
hex: This relentless attack does massive damage to a target affected by status conditions.
ice ball: The user continually rolls into the target over five turns. It becomes stronger each time it hits.
infestation: The target is infested and attacked for four to five turns. The target can’t flee during this time.
rock throw: The user picks up and throws a small rock at the target to attack.
nasty plot: The user stimulates its brain by thinking bad thoughts. This sharply raises the user’s Sp. Atk.
poison tail: The user hits the target with its tail. This may also poison the target. Critical hits land more easily.
razor wind: A two-turn attack. Blades of wind hit opposing Pokémon on the second turn. Critical hits land more easily.
switcheroo: The user trades held items with the target faster than the eye can follow.
guard split: The user employs its psychic power to average its Defense and Sp. Def stats with those of the target.
flash cannon: The user gathers all its light energy and releases it at once. This may also lower the target’s Sp. Def stat.
mirror move: The user counters the target by mimicking the target’s last move.
coil: The user coils up and concentrates. This raises its Attack and Defense stats as well as its accuracy.
nature power: An attack that makes use of nature’s power. Its effects vary depending on the user’s environment.
tri attack: The user strikes with a simultaneous three-beam attack. May also burn, freeze, or leave the target with paralysis.
low sweep: The user makes a swift attack on the target’s legs, which lowers the target’s Speed stat.
aerial ace: The user confounds the target with speed, then slashes. This attack never misses.
silver wind: The target is attacked with powdery scales blown by wind. This may also raise all the user’s stats.
submission: The user grabs the target and recklessly dives for the ground. This also damages the user a little.
geomancy: The user absorbs energy and sharply raises its Sp. Atk, Sp. Def, and Speed stats on the next turn.
tailwind: The user whips up a turbulent whirlwind that ups the Speed stat of the user and its allies for four turns.
head charge: The user charges its head into its target, using its powerful guard hair. This also damages the user a little.
gunk shot: The user shoots filthy garbage at the target to attack. This may also poison the target.
endeavor: An attack move that cuts down the target’s HP to equal the user’s HP.
razor leaf: Sharp-edged leaves are launched to slash at the opposing Pokémon. Critical hits land more easily.
leech life: The user drains the target’s blood. The user’s HP is restored by half the damage taken by the target.
thunder punch: The target is punched with an electrified fist. This may also leave the target with paralysis.
sleep powder: The user scatters a big cloud of sleep-inducing dust around the target.
cosmic power: The user absorbs a mystical power from space to raise its Defense and Sp. Def stats.
heal pulse: The user emits a healing pulse which restores the target’s HP by up to half of its max HP.
magnetic flux: The user manipulates magnetic fields, which raises the Defense and Sp. Def stats of ally Pokémon with the Plus or Minus Ability.
leaf storm: The user whips up a storm of leaves around the target. The attack’s recoil harshly lowers the user’s Sp. Atk stat.
tail glow: The user stares at flashing lights to focus its mind, drastically raising its Sp. Atk stat.
thunder fang: The user bites with electrified fangs. This may also make the target flinch or leave it with paralysis.
cut: The target is cut with a scythe or claw. This can also be used to cut down thin trees.
ice burn: On the second turn, an ultracold, freezing wind surrounds the target. This may leave the target with a burn.
perish song: Any Pokémon that hears this song faints in three turns, unless it switches out of battle.
crush claw: The user slashes the target with hard and sharp claws. This may also lower the target’s Defense stat.
horn attack: The target is jabbed with a sharply pointed horn to inflict damage.
dragon rage: This attack hits the target with a shock wave of pure rage. This attack always inflicts 40 HP damage.
psych up: The user hypnotizes itself into copying any stat change made by the target.
heat wave: The user attacks by exhaling hot breath on the opposing Pokémon. This may also leave those Pokémon with a burn.
cotton spore: The user releases cotton-like spores that cling to the opposing Pokémon, which harshly lowers their Speed stats.
string shot: The opposing Pokémon are bound with silk blown from the user’s mouth that harshly lowers the Speed stat.
entrainment: The user dances with an odd rhythm that compels the target to mimic it, making the target’s Ability the same as the user’s.
fury attack: The target is jabbed repeatedly with a horn or beak two to five times in a row.
embargo: This move prevents the target from using its held item. Its Trainer is also prevented from using items on it.
mind reader: The user senses the target’s movements with its mind to ensure its next attack does not miss the target.
leaf blade: The user handles a sharp leaf like a sword and attacks by cutting its target. Critical hits land more easily.
haze: The user creates a haze that eliminates every stat change among all the Pokémon engaged in battle.
kinesis: The user distracts the target by bending a spoon. This lowers the target’s accuracy.
poison powder: The user scatters a cloud of poisonous dust on the target. This may also poison the target.
hold back: The user holds back when it attacks and the target is left with at least 1 HP.
foul play: The user turns the target’s power against it. The higher the target’s Attack stat, the greater the move’s power.
worry seed: A seed that causes worry is planted on the target. It prevents sleep by making the target’s Ability Insomnia.
magnet rise: The user levitates using electrically generated magnetism for five turns.
roost: The user lands and rests its body. It restores the user’s HP by up to half of its max HP.
incinerate: The user attacks opposing Pokémon with fire. If a Pokémon is holding a certain item, such as a Berry, the item becomes burned up and unusable.
conversion: The user changes its type to become the same type as the move at the top of the list of moves it knows.
feather dance: The user covers the target’s body with a mass of down that harshly lowers its Attack stat.
ice fang: The user bites with cold-infused fangs. This may also make the target flinch or leave it frozen.
flame burst: The user attacks the target with a bursting flame. The bursting flame damages Pokémon next to the target as well.
growth: The user’s body grows all at once, raising the Attack and Sp. Atk stats.
frost breath: The user blows its cold breath on the target. This attack always results in a critical hit.
dragon claw: The user slashes the target with huge, sharp claws.
wild charge: The user shrouds itself in electricity and smashes into its target. This also damages the user a little.
take down: A reckless, full-body charge attack for slamming into the target. This also damages the user a little.
extrasensory: The user attacks with an odd, unseeable power. This may also make the target flinch.
telekinesis: The user makes the target float with its psychic power. The target is easier to hit for three turns.
belch: The user lets out a damaging belch at the target. The user must eat a held Berry to use this move.
giga drain: A nutrient-draining attack. The user’s HP is restored by half the damage taken by the target.
earth power: The user makes the ground under the target erupt with power. This may also lower the target’s Sp. Def.
helping hand: The user assists an ally by boosting the power of that ally’s attack.
fairy lock: By locking down the battlefield, the user keeps all Pokémon from fleeing during the next turn.
rage powder: The user scatters a cloud of irritating powder to draw attention to itself. Opponents aim only at the user.
trick room: The user creates a bizarre area in which slower Pokémon get to move first for five turns.
parting shot: With a parting threat, the user lowers the target’s Attack and Sp. Atk stats. Then it switches with a party Pokémon.
flamethrower: The target is scorched with an intense blast of fire. This may also leave the target with a burn.
stomp: The target is stomped with a big foot. This may also make the target flinch.
guard swap: The user employs its psychic power to switch changes to its Defense and Sp. Def stats with the target.
healing wish: The user faints. In return, the Pokémon taking its place will have its HP restored and status conditions cured.
horn leech: The user drains the target’s energy with its horns. The user’s HP is restored by half the damage taken by the target.
flower shield: The user raises the Defense stat of all Grass-type Pokémon in battle with a mysterious power.
energy ball: The user draws power from nature and fires it at the target. This may also lower the target’s Sp. Def.
head smash: The user attacks the target with a hazardous, full-power headbutt. This also damages the user terribly.
twister: The user whips up a vicious tornado to tear at the opposing Pokémon. This may also make them flinch.
thunder shock: A jolt of electricity crashes down on the target to inflict damage. This may also leave the target with paralysis.
aqua jet: The user lunges at the target at a speed that makes it almost invisible. This move always goes first.
quick attack: The user lunges at the target at a speed that makes it almost invisible. This move always goes first.
electro ball: The user hurls an electric orb at the target. The faster the user is than the target, the greater the move’s power.
iron defense: The user hardens its body’s surface like iron, sharply raising its Defense stat.
mach punch: The user throws a punch at blinding speed. This move always goes first.
stone edge: The user stabs the target with sharpened stones from below. Critical hits land more easily.
recycle: The user recycles a held item that has been used in battle so it can be used again.
metal burst: The user retaliates with much greater power against the target that last inflicted damage on it.
shadow sneak: The user extends its shadow and attacks the target from behind. This move always goes first.
heal order: The user calls out its underlings to heal it. The user regains up to half of its max HP.
snarl: The user yells as if it’s ranting about something, which lowers the Sp. Atk stat of opposing Pokémon.
foresight: Enables a Ghost-type target to be hit by Normal- and Fighting-type attacks. This also enables an evasive target to be hit.
double slap: The target is slapped repeatedly, back and forth, two to five times in a row.
body slam: The user drops onto the target with its full body weight. This may also leave the target with paralysis.
tail whip: The user wags its tail cutely, making opposing Pokémon less wary and lowering their Defense stat.
low kick: A powerful low kick that makes the target fall over. The heavier the target, the greater the move’s power.
magic coat: A barrier reflects back to the target moves like Leech Seed and moves that damage status.
explosion: The user attacks everything around it by causing a tremendous explosion. The user faints upon using this move.
meditate: The user meditates to awaken the power deep within its body and raise its Attack stat.
eruption: The user attacks opposing Pokémon with explosive fury. The lower the user’s HP, the lower the move’s power.
agility: The user relaxes and lightens its body to move faster. This sharply raises the Speed stat.
sucker punch: This move enables the user to attack first. This move fails if the target is not readying an attack.
focus blast: The user heightens its mental focus and unleashes its power. This may also lower the target’s Sp. Def.
hyper fang: The user bites hard on the target with its sharp front fangs. This may also make the target flinch.
giga impact: The user charges at the target using every bit of its power. The user can’t move on the next turn.
magnet bomb: The user launches steel bombs that stick to the target. This attack never misses.
calm mind: The user quietly focuses its mind and calms its spirit to raise its Sp. Atk and Sp. Def stats.
bulldoze: The user strikes everything around it by stomping down on the ground. This lowers the Speed stat of those hit.
crunch: The user crunches up the target with sharp fangs. This may also lower the target’s Defense stat.
mirror coat: A retaliation move that counters any special attack, inflicting double the damage taken.
gust: A gust of wind is whipped up by wings and launched at the target to inflict damage.
shadow ball: The user hurls a shadowy blob at the target. This may also lower the target’s Sp. Def stat.
superpower: The user attacks the target with great power. However, this also lowers the user’s Attack and Defense stats.
wide guard: The user and its allies are protected from wide-ranging attacks for one turn.
bind: Things such as long bodies or tentacles are used to bind and squeeze the target for four to five turns.
icy wind: The user attacks with a gust of chilled air. This also lowers the opposing Pokémon’s Speed stats.
role play: The user mimics the target completely, copying the target’s natural Ability.
brick break: The user attacks with a swift chop. It can also break barriers, such as Light Screen and Reflect.
icicle spear: The user launches sharp icicles at the target two to five times in a row.
peck: The target is jabbed with a sharply pointed beak or horn.
iron tail: The target is slammed with a steel-hard tail. This may also lower the target’s Defense stat.
follow me: The user draws attention to itself, making all targets take aim only at the user.
retaliate: The user gets revenge for a fainted ally. If an ally fainted in the previous turn, this move becomes more powerful.
jump kick: The user jumps up high, then strikes with a kick. If the kick misses, the user hurts itself.
swift: Star-shaped rays are shot at the opposing Pokémon. This attack never misses.
sand tomb: The user traps the target inside a harshly raging sandstorm for four to five turns.
lucky chant: The user chants an incantation toward the sky, preventing opposing Pokémon from landing critical hits.
fire punch: The target is punched with a fiery fist. This may also leave the target with a burn.
revenge: An attack move that inflicts double the damage if the user has been hurt by the opponent in the same turn.
flatter: Flattery is used to confuse the target. However, this also raises the target’s Sp. Atk stat.
razor shell: The user cuts its target with sharp shells. This may also lower the target’s Defense stat.
mat block: Using a pulled-up mat as a shield, the user protects itself and its allies from damaging moves. This does not stop status moves.
hyper voice: The user lets loose a horribly echoing shout with the power to inflict damage.
hammer arm: The user swings and hits with its strong and heavy fist. It lowers the user’s Speed, however.
tackle: A physical attack in which the user charges and slams into the target with its whole body.
wonder room: The user creates a bizarre area in which Pokémon’s Defense and Sp. Def stats are swapped for five turns.
flail: The user flails about aimlessly to attack. The less HP the user has, the greater the move’s power.
stealth rock: The user lays a trap of levitating stones around the opposing team. The trap hurts opposing Pokémon that switch into battle.
poison jab: The target is stabbed with a tentacle or arm steeped in poison. This may also poison the target.
heal bell: The user makes a soothing bell chime to heal the status conditions of all the party Pokémon.
freeze-dry: The user rapidly cools the target. This may also leave the target frozen. This move is super effective on Water types.
rock climb: The user attacks the target by smashing into it with incredible force. This may also confuse the target.
harden: The user stiffens all the muscles in its body to raise its Defense stat.
grass knot: The user snares the target with grass and trips it. The heavier the target, the greater the move’s power.
water sport: The user soaks itself with water. This weakens Fire-type moves for five turns.
whirlpool: The user traps the target in a violent swirling whirlpool for four to five turns.
synthesis: The user restores its own HP. The amount of HP regained varies with the weather.
rototiller: Tilling the soil, the user makes it easier for plants to grow. This raises the Attack and Sp. Atk stats of Grass-type Pokémon.
earthquake: The user sets off an earthquake that strikes every Pokémon around it.
judgment: The user releases countless shots of light at the target. This move’s type varies depending on the kind of Plate the user is holding.
high jump kick: The target is attacked with a knee kick from a jump. If it misses, the user is hurt instead.
overheat: The user attacks the target at full power. The attack’s recoil harshly lowers the user’s Sp. Atk stat.
land's wrath: The user gathers the energy of the land and focuses that power on opposing Pokémon to damage them.
rock slide: Large boulders are hurled at the opposing Pokémon to inflict damage. This may also make the opposing Pokémon flinch.
king's shield: The user takes a defensive stance while it protects itself from damage. It also harshly lowers the Attack stat of any attacker who makes direct contact.
surf: The user attacks everything around it by swamping its surroundings with a giant wave. This can also be used for crossing water.
thunder wave: The user launches a weak jolt of electricity that paralyzes the target.
focus punch: The user focuses its mind before launching a punch. This move fails if the user is hit before it is used.
swords dance: A frenetic dance to uplift the fighting spirit. This sharply raises the user’s Attack stat.
growl: The user growls in an endearing way, making opposing Pokémon less wary. This lowers their Attack stats.
thunder: A wicked thunderbolt is dropped on the target to inflict damage. This may also leave the target with paralysis.
taunt: The target is taunted into a rage that allows it to use only attack moves for three turns.
uproar: The user attacks in an uproar for three turns. During that time, no one can fall asleep.
fire fang: The user bites with flame-cloaked fangs. This may also make the target flinch or leave it with a burn.
double-edge: A reckless, life-risking tackle. This also damages the user quite a lot.
fury cutter: The target is slashed with scythes or claws. This attack becomes more powerful if it hits in succession.
focus energy: The user takes a deep breath and focuses so that critical hits land more easily.
snatch: The user steals the effects of any attempts to use a healing or stat-changing move.
shock wave: The user strikes the target with a quick jolt of electricity. This attack never misses.
rock smash: The user attacks with a punch. This may also lower the target’s Defense stat. This move can also shatter rocks in the field.
reflect: A wondrous wall of light is put up to reduce damage from physical attacks for five turns.
ice beam: The target is struck with an icy-cold beam of energy. This may also leave the target frozen.
fire blast: The target is attacked with an intense blast of all-consuming fire. This may also leave the target with a burn.
mud-slap: The user hurls mud in the target’s face to inflict damage and lower its accuracy.
fly: The user soars and then strikes its target on the next turn. This can also be used to fly to any familiar town.
flame charge: Cloaking itself in flame, the user attacks. Then, building up more power, the user raises its Speed stat.
refresh: The user rests to cure itself of a poisoning, burn, or paralysis.
light screen: A wondrous wall of light is put up to reduce damage from special attacks for five turns.
knock off: The user slaps down the target’s held item, and that item can’t be used in that battle. The move does more damage if the target has a held item.
solar beam: A two-turn attack. The user gathers light, then blasts a bundled beam on the next turn.
shadow claw: The user slashes with a sharp claw made from shadows. Critical hits land more easily.
ice punch: The target is punched with an icy fist. This may also leave the target frozen.
hone claws: The user sharpens its claws to boost its Attack stat and accuracy.
psyshock: The user materializes an odd psychic wave to attack the target. This attack does physical damage.
hydro pump: The target is blasted by a huge volume of water launched under great pressure.
shadow punch: The user throws a punch from the shadows. This attack never misses.
ice shard: The user flash-freezes chunks of ice and hurls them at the target. This move always goes first.
camouflage: The user’s type is changed depending on its environment, such as at water’s edge, in grass, or in a cave.
confuse ray: The target is exposed to a sinister ray that triggers confusion.
defog: A strong wind blows away the target’s barriers such as Reflect or Light Screen. This also lowers the target’s evasiveness.
feint attack: The user approaches the target disarmingly, then throws a sucker punch. This attack never misses.
fake out: An attack that hits first and makes the target flinch. It only works the first turn the user is in battle.
fling: The user flings its held item at the target to attack. This move’s power and effects depend on the item.
protect: Enables the user to evade all attacks. Its chance of failing rises if it is used in succession.
rock tomb: Boulders are hurled at the target. This also lowers the target’s Speed stat by preventing its movement.
thief: The user attacks and steals the target’s held item simultaneously. The user can’t steal anything if it already holds an item.
flash: The user flashes a bright light that cuts the target’s accuracy.
outrage: The user rampages and attacks for two to three turns. The user then becomes confused.
rain dance: The user summons a heavy rain that falls for five turns, powering up Water-type moves.
gyro ball: The user tackles the target with a high-speed spin. The slower the user compared to the target, the greater the move’s power.
roar: The target is scared off, and a different Pokémon is dragged out. In the wild, this ends a battle against a single Pokémon.
dragon dance: The user vigorously performs a mystic, powerful dance that raises its Attack and Speed stats.
screech: An earsplitting screech harshly lowers the target’s Defense stat.
facade: An attack move that doubles its power if the user is poisoned, burned, or has paralysis.
sleep talk: While it is asleep, the user randomly uses one of the moves it knows.
strength: The target is slugged with a punch thrown at maximum power. This can also be used to move heavy boulders.
dynamic punch: The user punches the target with full, concentrated power. This confuses the target if it hits.
captivate: If any opposing Pokémon is the opposite gender of the user, it is charmed, which harshly lowers its Sp. Atk stat.
dive: Diving on the first turn, the user floats up and attacks on the next turn.
water pulse: The user attacks the target with a pulsing blast of water. This may also confuse the target.
zen headbutt: The user focuses its willpower to its head and attacks the target. This may also make the target flinch.
psychic: The target is hit by a strong telekinetic force. This may also lower the target’s Sp. Def stat.
safeguard: The user creates a protective field that prevents status conditions for five turns.
confusion: The target is hit by a weak telekinetic force. This may also confuse the target.
seismic toss: The target is thrown using the power of gravity. It inflicts damage equal to the user’s level.
close combat: The user fights the target up close without guarding itself. This also lowers the user’s Defense and Sp. Def stats.
scary face: The user frightens the target with a scary face to harshly lower its Speed stat.
steel wing: The target is hit with wings of steel. This may also raise the user’s Defense stat.
sacred fire: The target is razed with a mystical fire of great intensity. This may also leave the target with a burn.
ember: The target is attacked with small flames. This may also leave the target with a burn.
beat up: The user gets all party Pokémon to attack the target. The more party Pokémon, the greater the number of attacks.
struggle: An attack that is used in desperation only if the user has no PP. This also damages the user a little.
recover: Restoring its own cells, the user restores its own HP by half of its max HP.
clamp: The target is clamped and squeezed by the user’s very thick and sturdy shell for four to five turns.
attract: If it is the opposite gender of the user, the target becomes infatuated and less likely to attack.
sunny day: The user intensifies the sun for five turns, powering up Fire-type moves.
secret power: The user attacks the target with a secret power. Its additional effects vary depending on the user’s environment.
frustration: A full-power attack that grows more powerful the less the user likes its Trainer.
covet: The user endearingly approaches the target, then steals the target’s held item.
endure: The user endures any attack with at least 1 HP. Its chance of failing rises if it is used in succession.
substitute: The user makes a copy of itself using some of its HP. The copy serves as the user’s decoy.
double team: By moving rapidly, the user makes illusory copies of itself to raise its evasiveness.
snore: An attack that can be used only if the user is asleep. The harsh noise may also make the target flinch.
toxic: A move that leaves the target badly poisoned. Its poison damage worsens every turn.
round: The user attacks the target with a song. Others can join in the Round and make the attack do greater damage.
mimic: The user copies the target’s last move. The move can be used during battle until the Pokémon is switched out.
swagger: The user enrages and confuses the target. However, this also sharply raises the target’s Attack stat.
rest: The user goes to sleep for two turns. This fully restores the user’s HP and heals any status conditions.
return: A full-power attack that grows more powerful the more the user likes its Trainer.
confide: The user tells the target a secret, and the target loses its ability to concentrate. This lowers the target’s Sp. Atk stat.
dig: The user burrows, then attacks on the next turn. It can also be used to exit dungeons.
scratch: Hard, pointed, sharp claws rake the target to inflict damage.
headbutt: The user sticks out its head and attacks by charging straight into the target. This may also make the target flinch.
work up: The user is roused, and its Attack and Sp. Atk stats increase.
thunderbolt: A strong electric blast crashes down on the target. This may also leave the target with paralysis.
signal beam: The user attacks with a sinister beam of light. This may also confuse the target.
spite: The user unleashes its grudge on the move last used by the target by cutting 4 PP from it.
heavy slam: The user slams into the target with its heavy body. The more the user outweighs the target, the greater the move’s power.
glaciate: The user attacks by blowing freezing cold air at opposing Pokémon. This lowers their Speed stat.
disable: For four turns, this move prevents the target from using the move it last used.
charge beam: The user attacks with an electric charge. The user may use any remaining electricity to raise its Sp. Atk stat.
sand attack: Sand is hurled in the target’s face, reducing the target’s accuracy.
bonemerang: The user throws the bone it holds. The bone loops to hit the target twice, coming and going.
encore: The user compels the target to keep using only the move it last used for three turns.
dizzy punch: The target is hit with rhythmically launched punches. This may also leave the target confused.
chatter: The user attacks using a sound wave based on words it has learned. This confuses the target.
ominous wind: The user blasts the target with a gust of repulsive wind. This may also raise all the user’s stats at once.
chip away: Looking for an opening, the user strikes consistently. The target’s stat changes don’t affect this attack’s damage.
odor sleuth: Enables a Ghost-type target to be hit by Normal- and Fighting-type attacks. This also enables an evasive target to be hit.
seed bomb: The user slams a barrage of hard-shelled seeds down on the target from above.
spider web: The user ensnares the target with thin, gooey silk so it can’t flee from battle.
spore: The user scatters bursts of spores that induce sleep.
dragon breath: The user exhales a mighty gust that inflicts damage. This may also leave the target with paralysis.
natural gift: The user draws power to attack by using its held Berry. The Berry determines the move’s type and power.
hidden power: A unique attack that varies in type depending on the Pokémon using it.
hyper beam: The target is attacked with a powerful beam. The user can’t move on the next turn.
noble roar: Letting out a noble roar, the user intimidates the target and lowers its Attack and Sp. Atk stats.
pay day: Numerous coins are hurled at the target to inflict damage. Money is earned after the battle.
attack order: The user calls out its underlings to pummel the target. Critical hits land more easily.
heart stamp: The user unleashes a vicious blow after its cute act makes the target less wary. This may also make the target flinch.
magical leaf: The user scatters curious leaves that chase the target. This attack never misses.
lunar dance: The user faints. In return, the Pokémon taking its place will have its status and HP fully restored.
miracle eye: Enables a Dark-type target to be hit by Psychic-type attacks. This also enables an evasive target to be hit.
octazooka: The user attacks by spraying ink in the target’s face or eyes. This may also lower the target’s accuracy.
rolling kick: The user lashes out with a quick, spinning kick. This may also make the target flinch.
ion deluge: The user disperses electrically charged particles, which changes Normal-type moves to Electric-type moves.
blue flare: The user attacks by engulfing the target in an intense, yet beautiful, blue flame. This may also leave the target with a burn.
roar of time: The user blasts the target with power that distorts even time. The user can’t move on the next turn.
freeze shock: On the second turn, the user hits the target with electrically charged ice. This may also leave the target with paralysis.
discharge: The user strikes everything around it by letting loose a flare of electricity. This may also cause paralysis.
spiky shield: In addition to protecting the user from attacks, this move also damages any attacker who makes direct contact.
dream eater: The user eats the dreams of a sleeping target. It absorbs half the damage caused to heal its own HP.
payback: The user stores power, then attacks. If the user moves after the target, this attack’s power will be doubled.
dragon pulse: The target is attacked with a shock wave generated by the user’s gaping mouth.
